verses.verse: Then it came<WH1961> about afterwards<WH310> <WH3651> that David<WH1732> inquired<WH7592> of the Lord,<WH3068> saying,<WH559> "Shall I go<WH5927> up to one<WH259> of the cities<WH5892> of Judah<WH3063>?" "Now<WH6258> therefore, let your hands<WH3027> be strong,<WH2388> and be valiant<WH1121>;<WH2428> for Saul<WH7586> your lord<WH113> is dead,<WH4191> and also<WH1571> the house<WH1004> of Judah<WH3063> has anointed<WH4886> me king<WH4428> over<WH5921> them."

And the time<WH4557> <WH3117> that David<WH1732> was king<WH4428> in Hebron<WH2275> over<WH5921> the house<WH1004> of Judah<WH3063> was seven<WH7651> years<WH8141> and six<WH8337> months.<WH2320>

And that day<WH3117> the battle<WH4421> was very<WH3966> severe,<WH7186> and Abner<WH74> and the men<WH376> of Israel<WH3478> were beaten<WH5062> before<WH6440> the servants<WH5650> of David.<WH1732>

Now the three<WH7969> sons<WH1121> of Zeruiah<WH6870> were there,<WH8033> Joab<WH3097> and Abishai<WH52> and Asahel;<WH6214> and Asahel<WH6214> [was as] swift-footed as one<WH259> of the gazelles<WH6643> which<WH834> is in the field.<WH7704>
And Asahel<WH6214> pursued<WH7291> Abner<WH74> and did not turn<WH5186> to the right<WH3225> or to the left<WH8040> from following<WH310> Abner.<WH74>
Then Abner<WH74> looked<WH6437> behind<WH310> him and said,<WH559> "Is that you, Asahel<WH6214>?" And he answered,<WH559> "It is I."

So Abner<WH74> said<WH559> to him, "Turn<WH5186> to your right<WH3225> or<WH176> to your left,<WH8040> and take<WH270> hold<WH270> of one<WH259> of the young<WH5288> men<WH5288> for yourself, and take<WH3947> for yourself his spoil.<WH2488>" But Asahel<WH6214> was not willing<WH14> to turn<WH5493> aside<WH5493> from following<WH310> him.

And Abner<WH74> repeated<WH3254> <WH559> again<WH5750> to Asahel,<WH6214> "Turn<WH5493> aside<WH5493> from following<WH310> me. Why<WH4100> should I strike<WH5221> you to the ground<WH776>? How<WH349> then could I lift<WH5375> up my face<WH6440> to your brother<WH251> Joab<WH3097>?"

However, he refused<WH3985> to turn<WH5493> aside;<WH5493> therefore Abner<WH74> struck<WH5221> him in the belly<WH2570> with the butt<WH310> end<WH310> of the spear,<WH2595> so that the spear<WH2595> came<WH3318> out at his back.<WH310> And he fell<WH5307> there<WH8033> and died<WH4191> on the spot.<WH8478> And it came<WH1961> about that all<WH3605> who came<WH935> to the place<WH4725> where<WH834> <WH8033> Asahel<WH6214> had fallen<WH5307> and died,<WH4191> stood<WH5975> still.<WH5975>

But Joab<WH3097> and Abishai<WH52> pursued<WH7291> Abner,<WH74> and when the sun<WH8121> was going<WH935> down, they came<WH935> to the hill<WH1389> of Ammah,<WH522> which<WH834> is in front<WH6440> of Giah<WH1520> by the way<WH1870> of the wilderness<WH4057> of Gibeon.<WH1391>

And the sons<WH1121> of Benjamin<WH1144> gathered<WH6908> together behind<WH310> Abner<WH74> and became<WH1961> one<WH259> band,<WH92> and they stood<WH5975> on the top<WH7218> of a certain<WH259> hill.<WH1389>
